course_title: Special Topics: American Questions: The Seventies

class_notes:
(Same as REL 270 2, HIST 296 3, and WGS 285 2)
(This course satisfies the Religion major requirement:- Region, Theme.)
(Dubbed the "Me Decade" by the writer Tom Wolfe, the 1970s in the United States can be caricatured as "a decade of disco, decadence, drug use, divorce ... cultural decay" (in the words of the historian Kevin Mattson). It certainly was a period when many Americans experienced long taken-for-granted norms and values as under assault, when President Jimmy Carter spoke of an American "crisis of confidence." It was also a time of significant social movements that continue to be relevant today, more than fifty years after the 1970s began. In this course we will focus on two movements that developed in a complex relationship of symbiotic conflict: Gay Rights and the Religious Right. These movements will be investigated as representative of the "Me Decade," within its larger social, political, and cultural contexts. In this cultural history course, special attention will be given to primary source materials, particularly popular media, such as news magazines, novels, movies, television programs, and music. There will be disco!)
